items.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
items.plainText: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

items.text: Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?
items.plainText: Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?

items.text: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?
items.plainText: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?

items.text: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment?
items.plainText: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment?

items.text: Is not thy wickedness great? and thine iniquities infinite?
items.plainText: Is not thy wickedness great? and thine iniquities infinite?

items.text: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.
items.plainText: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.

items.text: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.
items.plainText: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.

items.text: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honourable man dwelt in it.
items.plainText: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honourable man dwelt in it.

items.text: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
items.plainText: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.

items.text: Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;
items.plainText: Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;

items.text: Or darkness, that thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.
items.plainText: Or darkness, that thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.

items.text: Is not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!
items.plainText: Is not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!

items.text: And thou sayest, How doth God know? can he judge through the dark cloud?
items.plainText: And thou sayest, How doth God know? can he judge through the dark cloud?

items.text: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.
items.plainText: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.

items.text: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?
items.plainText: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?

items.text: Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood:
items.plainText: Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood:

items.text: Which said unto God, Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them?
items.plainText: Which said unto God, Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them?

items.text: Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
items.plainText: Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

items.text: The righteous see it, and are glad: and the innocent laugh them to scorn.
items.plainText: The righteous see it, and are glad: and the innocent laugh them to scorn.

items.text: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.
items.plainText: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.

items.text: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.
items.plainText: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.

items.text: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.
items.plainText: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.

items.text: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.
items.plainText: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.

items.text: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.
items.plainText: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.

items.text: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.
items.plainText: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.

items.text: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.
items.plainText: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.

items.text: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.
items.plainText: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.

items.text: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.
items.plainText: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.

items.text: When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.
items.plainText: When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.

items.text: He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.
items.plainText: He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.
